intro: Osmorhiza brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed boneset, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are fibrous and have been historically used in traditional medicine. Osmorhiza brachypoda typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and woodland edges.
